items.name: Agent Creator
items.description: Create well-configured Claude Code agents with the right tools, permissions, and model for the job. Covers all frontmatter fields, permission modes, model selection tradeoffs, agent lifecycle, common mistakes, and battle-tested patterns for research agents, reviewers, and multi-agent teams.

items.name: CLAUDE.md Doctor
items.description: Audit your CLAUDE.md files and .claude/rules/ for quality issues, staleness, anti-patterns, and token bloat, then generate a scored health report with severity-rated fixes you can apply interactively.
items.longDescription: Scans all project instruction files (root CLAUDE.md, package-level overrides, .claude.local.md, and modular rules) to evaluate token efficiency, command accuracy, path validity, frontmatter correctness, and rule modularity. Produces a file-by-file scorecard with critical/warning/low findings, then offers automatic, critical-only, or per-fix approval workflows.

items.name: Code Smell Doctor
items.description: Analyze code for all 23 classic code smells from Martin Fowler's catalog, with severity ratings and targeted refactoring recommendations for each detected smell.
items.longDescription: Systematically scans code across five smell categories: Bloaters (Long Method, Large Class, Primitive Obsession, Long Parameter List, Data Clumps), OO Abusers, Change Preventers, Dispensables, and Couplers. Reports each finding with severity, exact location, evidence from the code, and the specific refactoring technique to fix it.

items.name: Design Patterns
items.description: Identify when and how to apply the 23 Gang of Four design patterns, with a problem-to-pattern selection guide and implementation examples in TypeScript.
items.longDescription: Covers all Creational (Factory Method, Abstract Factory, Builder, Prototype, Singleton), Structural (Adapter, Bridge, Composite, Decorator, Facade, Flyweight, Proxy), and Behavioral patterns (Chain of Responsibility, Command, Iterator, Mediator, Memento, Observer, State, Strategy, Template Method, Visitor). Each pattern includes intent, when to use, quick implementation examples, and common pitfalls.

items.name: Lint Doctor
items.description: Detect your project's language and framework, then configure linting with sensible defaults -- supports ESLint (with sonarjs/unicorn), Ruff, Clippy, golangci-lint, and Checkstyle, plus optional pre-commit hooks.
items.longDescription: Auto-detects your stack from config files (package.json, Cargo.toml, go.mod, pyproject.toml, pom.xml, etc.) and applies best-practice lint rules with bug/security errors and style warnings. Supports JavaScript/TypeScript with React/Vue/Angular, Python via Ruff, Rust via Clippy, Go via golangci-lint, and Java via Checkstyle. Handles monorepos and offers interactive or automatic configuration with optional husky/lint-staged or pre-commit hook setup.

items.name: Project Security Guard
items.description: Project-scoped PreToolUse hook that blocks dangerous Bash commands (rm outside project, force push, DROP TABLE, terraform destroy, docker prune, eval, network exfiltration) and sensitive file access, while auto-approving safe dev workflow commands and remembering granted permissions.

items.name: Refactoring Techniques
items.description: Apply the right refactoring technique from Martin Fowler's catalog of 66 techniques, organized by the code problem you are trying to solve: long methods, misplaced features, messy data, complex conditionals, or awkward APIs.
items.longDescription: Covers six categories with step-by-step mechanics: Composing Methods (Extract Method, Inline Temp, etc.), Moving Features (Move Method/Field, Extract/Inline Class), Organizing Data (Encapsulate Field, Replace Type Code), Simplifying Conditionals (Decompose Conditional, Replace with Polymorphism, Guard Clauses), Simplifying Method Calls (Introduce Parameter Object, Separate Query from Modifier), and Dealing with Generalization (Pull Up/Push Down, Extract Superclass/Interface).

items.name: Universal Security Guard
items.description: User-scoped PreToolUse hook that blocks universally dangerous operations across all projects: reverse shells, sudo/privilege escalation, credential file reads, keychain access, persistence mechanisms (crontab, launchctl, systemd), library injection, container escapes, and git config attacks. Never auto-approves -- only denies threats and defers safe commands to normal permission flow.

items.name: Asana
items.description: Create and manage Asana tasks, search projects, and update assignments from Claude Code. Link code changes to project tasks and keep your team's work management in sync without leaving your editor.

items.name: Audit Context Building
items.description: Security audit plugin from Trail of Bits that builds deep architectural context through ultra-granular function-level code analysis before vulnerability hunting. Includes a function-analyzer agent and completeness checklists to ensure thorough coverage.

items.name: Context7
items.description: Pull version-specific library documentation and code examples directly into your prompt context. Eliminates hallucinated APIs by fetching real docs from source repositories instead of relying on training data.

items.name: Firebase
items.description: Manage Firestore databases, authentication, cloud functions, hosting, and storage directly from Claude Code. Build and iterate on your Firebase backend without switching to the Google Cloud console.

items.name: Github
items.description: Create issues, manage pull requests, review code, search repos, and access GitHub's full API without leaving Claude Code. Complements the built-in gh CLI with structured MCP tool access to the GitHub platform.

items.name: Gitlab
items.description: Manage GitLab repositories, merge requests, CI/CD pipelines, issues, and wikis directly from Claude Code. Provides MCP access to GitLab's full DevOps lifecycle without leaving your editor.

items.name: Greptile
items.description: View and resolve Greptile's AI-powered PR review comments directly from Claude Code. Connects to Greptile's codebase-aware code review for GitHub and GitLab pull requests.

items.name: Laravel Boost
items.description: Laravel-aware development assistance via MCP. Run Artisan commands, scaffold Eloquent models, manage routes and migrations, and generate framework-idiomatic code with knowledge of Laravel conventions and best practices.

items.name: Linear
items.description: Create and update Linear issues, manage projects and cycles, and search across workspaces from Claude Code. Keeps your issue tracker in sync with your code changes without context-switching to the Linear app.

items.name: Playwright
items.description: Gives Claude Code browser automation capabilities via Microsoft's Playwright. Interact with web pages, take screenshots, fill forms, click elements, and run end-to-end test workflows across Chromium, Firefox, and WebKit.

items.name: React Best Practices
items.description: 57 performance rules from Vercel Engineering for React and Next.js apps. Covers waterfall prevention, bundle size reduction, server/client optimization, re-render elimination, and JS performance patterns to catch performance issues during code generation and review.

items.name: React Composition Patterns
items.description: Vercel's guide to scalable React component architecture. Teaches compound components, explicit variants, context-based state, and React 19 patterns to replace boolean prop proliferation with flexible, composable component APIs.

items.name: React Native Skills
items.description: 38 rules from Vercel for building performant React Native and Expo apps. Covers list virtualization, Reanimated animations, native UI components, navigation, monorepo setup, and React Compiler compatibility to catch mobile performance pitfalls during development.

items.name: Serena
items.description: Adds LSP-powered semantic code intelligence to Claude Code. Navigate symbols, find references, get refactoring suggestions, and understand code structure using language server protocol analysis instead of text-based search.

items.name: Slack
items.description: Search Slack messages, read channels and threads, and pull team discussions into your coding context. Useful for finding prior decisions, debugging context, or relevant conversations without leaving Claude Code.

items.name: Stripe
items.description: Stripe integration with MCP tools, best-practices skill, and slash commands for explaining errors and looking up test cards. Helps you build and debug Stripe payment integrations following official patterns.

items.name: Supabase
items.description: Manage Supabase projects, run SQL queries, configure auth, and interact with storage and real-time subscriptions directly from Claude Code. Lets you build and iterate on your Supabase backend without switching to the dashboard.

items.name: Superpowers
items.description: Comprehensive skills library by Jesse Vincent that teaches Claude Code proven development workflows: TDD, systematic debugging, subagent-driven development, code review, git worktrees, plan writing, and brainstorming. Includes a code-reviewer agent and slash commands for planning and execution.

items.name: Web Design Guidelines
items.description: Vercel's web interface design guidelines for reviewing UI code. Checks accessibility, UX patterns, and design best practices to catch common issues in HTML, CSS, and component markup before they reach production.

items.name: Agent Sdk Dev
items.description: Scaffolds new Claude Agent SDK projects in Python or TypeScript with /new-sdk-app, then validates them against SDK best practices using language-specific verifier agents that check API usage, type safety, security, and environment configuration.

items.name: Algorithmic Art
items.description: Generate original algorithmic art using p5.js with seeded randomness and interactive parameter controls. Supports flow fields, particle systems, and other generative techniques, producing reproducible artwork with a built-in HTML viewer for exploration.

items.name: Brand Guidelines
items.description: Apply Anthropic's official brand identity -- colors, typography, and visual style -- to any artifact. Ensures slides, documents, web pages, and other outputs match Anthropic's design standards for a consistent, professional look.

items.name: Canvas Design
items.description: Design original static visuals -- posters, art prints, infographics, and other graphic pieces -- exported as PNG or PDF. Ships with 30+ bundled fonts for rich typography and applies design-first principles to produce polished, print-ready output.

items.name: Claude Code Setup
items.description: Scans your project structure and recommends the best Claude Code automations to set up, including MCP servers, skills, hooks, subagents, and slash commands tailored to your specific codebase.

items.name: Claude Md Management
items.description: Audit and improve your CLAUDE.md files to keep them in sync with your codebase. Includes a quality checker for periodic maintenance and a /revise-claude-md command to capture session learnings before they're lost.

items.name: Code Review
items.description: Launches parallel review agents that independently audit PRs for guideline compliance, bugs, and historical context issues. Only findings scoring 80+ confidence are posted as GitHub comments, reducing false positives while maintaining thorough coverage.

items.name: Code Simplifier
items.description: Autonomous refactoring agent that improves recently modified code by reducing nesting, consolidating logic, improving naming, and enforcing project conventions. Preserves all existing behavior while making code more readable and maintainable.

items.name: Commit Commands
items.description: Slash commands for common git operations: /commit analyzes changes and matches your repo's commit style, /commit-push-pr handles branching through PR creation with auto-generated descriptions, and /clean_gone removes stale local branches deleted from the remote.

items.name: Doc Coauthoring
items.description: Co-author documentation through a structured, iterative workflow. Helps you write proposals, technical specs, decision docs, and similar structured content by guiding context transfer, collaborative refinement, and reader verification.

items.name: Docx
items.description: Create, read, and edit Word documents (.docx) with professional formatting. Supports tables of contents, headings, page numbers, images, tracked changes, comments, find-and-replace, and OOXML validation for reliable, polished output.

items.name: Explanatory Output Style
items.description: Restores the deprecated Explanatory output style via a session-start hook. Claude automatically includes bordered insight sections explaining implementation trade-offs, codebase-specific patterns, and design decisions relevant to your project.

items.name: Feature Dev
items.description: Guided 7-phase feature development workflow that launches parallel agents to explore your codebase, design multiple architecture options with trade-off analysis, implement changes, and run confidence-scored quality review before merging.

items.name: Frontend Design
items.description: Generates production-ready web interfaces with intentional design direction, distinctive typography, cohesive color systems, and polished animations. Automatically activates for frontend tasks across HTML/CSS, React, Vue, and other frameworks to avoid generic AI-generated aesthetics.

items.name: Frontend Design
items.description: Generate production-grade frontend interfaces with distinctive, non-generic design. Produces polished websites, landing pages, dashboards, and React components with thoughtful typography, spacing, and color that stand apart from typical AI-generated UI.

items.name: Hookify
items.description: Create custom behavioral rules from natural language descriptions or by analyzing recent conversation patterns. Rules use regex pattern matching to warn or block on bash commands, file edits, and prompts, taking effect immediately without restarts.

items.name: Internal Comms
items.description: Draft polished internal communications following proven corporate formats. Includes templates and examples for status reports, leadership updates, 3P updates, company newsletters, FAQs, incident reports, and project updates.

items.name: Learning Output Style
items.description: Transforms Claude into a coding tutor that pauses at key decision points and asks you to write 5-10 lines of meaningful code, such as business logic and algorithm choices, while handling boilerplate automatically. Restores the unshipped Learning output style.

items.name: Mcp Builder
items.description: Build and evaluate MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers in Python (FastMCP) or Node/TypeScript (MCP SDK). Provides best-practice references, connection testing scripts, and an evaluation framework to ensure your server integrates cleanly with LLM toolchains.

items.name: Pdf
items.description: Full-featured PDF toolkit for reading, creating, merging, splitting, and editing PDF files. Supports form filling (both native and annotation-based), text/table extraction, page rotation, watermarks, encryption, image extraction, and OCR for scanned documents.

items.name: Playground
items.description: Generates self-contained interactive HTML playgrounds with visual controls, live preview, and copyable prompt output. Includes templates for design exploration, data queries, concept maps, code visualization, diff review, and document critique.

items.name: Pptx
items.description: Create, read, and edit PowerPoint presentations (.pptx). Handles slide creation, deck assembly, text extraction, template application, speaker notes, comments, and layout management. Includes PptxGenJS integration, OOXML validation, and thumbnail generation for reliable output.

items.name: Pr Review Toolkit
items.description: Six specialized PR review agents that analyze comment accuracy, test coverage gaps, silent error handling, type design quality, guideline compliance, and code simplification opportunities. Run them in parallel or sequentially for staged review workflows.

items.name: Ralph Loop
items.description: Runs Claude in a persistent feedback loop that re-executes your prompt after each iteration, letting it self-correct based on test failures, lint errors, and file changes until the task is complete. Ideal for well-defined tasks with automated verification.

items.name: Security Guidance
items.description: Pre-tool-use hook that intercepts file edits and blocks writes containing vulnerable patterns like shell injection, eval(), dangerouslySetInnerHTML, pickle deserialization, and GitHub Actions command injection. Tracks warnings per session to avoid duplicate alerts.

items.name: Skill Creator
items.description: Scaffold, validate, and package new Claude Code skills. Walks you through creating SKILL.md files with proper structure, output patterns, and workflow definitions, then validates and bundles the result for distribution.

items.name: Slack Gif Creator
items.description: Create animated GIFs optimized for Slack's size and display constraints. Provides a frame composer, easing functions, GIF builder, and validators to produce smooth, compact animations that look great in Slack channels.

items.name: Theme Factory
items.description: Apply professional visual themes to any artifact -- slides, documents, reports, landing pages, and more. Includes 10 curated themes (Arctic Frost, Golden Hour, Midnight Galaxy, etc.) with coordinated colors and fonts, plus the ability to generate custom themes on the fly.

items.name: Web Artifacts Builder
items.description: Build multi-component HTML artifacts for claude.ai using React, Tailwind CSS, and shadcn/ui. Scaffolds, bundles, and packages complex artifacts with state management and routing into a single deployable file.

items.name: Webapp Testing
items.description: Test and debug local web applications using Playwright. Automates browser interactions, captures screenshots, reads console logs, discovers elements, and verifies frontend behavior -- all without needing a separate testing framework setup.

items.name: Xlsx
items.description: Create, read, edit, and transform spreadsheet files (.xlsx, .xlsm, .csv, .tsv). Handles formula computation, formatting, charting, data cleaning, column manipulation, and format conversion. Includes OOXML schema validation and recalculation tooling for reliable output.
